author: Cory McCord (KHOU)
title: Texas hospitals to report healthcare costs for illegal immigrants | khou.com
text: AUSTIN, Texas — Gov. Greg Abbott on Thursday issued an [executive order](https://gov.texas.gov/uploads/files/press/EO-GA-46_HHSC_Alienage_Data_IMAGE_08-08-2024.pdf) that requires Texas public hospitals to collect information on undocumented immigrants who receive care, including the cost of care, in an effort to get the federal government to pay the state for those costs. In a release, Abbott said he issued the order because of what he called President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris' "open border policies." RELATED: [Abbott ordena a hospitales públicos de Texas recopilar información sobre inmigrantes indocumentados](/article/news/local/texas/abbott-ordena-hospitales-texas-inmigrantes-indocumentados/285-dc68f55d-bb3d-4ab2-81c8-b2f2c45d6ba8) Abbott said the state would be fighting to get the federal government to pay for the medical costs associated with treating undocumented immigrants. The Texas Health and Human Services Commission will: - Direct hospitals and additional identified providers to collect information regarding the cost of medical care provided to undocumented immigrants, beginning by Nov. 1. - Direct covered hospitals to report such data to HHSC quarterly, with initial submissions due March 1, 2025. - Direct those hospitals to inform the patient that federal law mandates that any response to such questions will not affect patient care. - Report annually, beginning on Jan. 1, 2026, to the Governor, the Lieutenant Governor, and the Speaker of the House on the preceding year’s costs for medical care provided to undocumented immigrants. The order applies to hospitals enrolled in Medicaid or the Children's Health Insurance Program as well as any others identified by the HHSC. Harris Health, which runs Ben Taub, LBJ and other county health clinics, told KHOU 11 News that it would comply with the order. KHOU 11 Legal Analyst Carmen Roe said other states and cities have similar laws in place. She also said people in need of care can't be forced to answer a question about immigration status and can't be denied services based on their immigration status. KHOU 11 has reached out to local hospitals to find out if they'll comply as well as the governor's office and Texas Health and Human Services for comment.

author: ConservativeMind
title: Thyroid treatment may improve gut health in people with hypothyroidism
text:
People with an underactive thyroid may have an increased risk of developing small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO), a risk that may be reduced with thyroid hormone treatment, according to a study.
"We now know that people with hypothyroidism, especially those with autoimmune thyroiditis, are more likely to develop SIBO, but this risk appears to be mitigated in those taking thyroid medications," said Ruchi Mathur, M.D.
Mathur said their research also suggests there may be a microbiological mechanism driving this association, which could lead to more personalized treatments.
The researchers investigated the relationship between SIBO and hypothyroidism in people older than 18 who previously underwent upper endoscopy without colon prep and reported living with hypothyroidism as well as controls. Subjects were recruited through their REIMAGINE study.
They analyzed small bowel fluid samples from 49 people with hypothyroidism and 323 without the condition and performed DNA sequencing to identify microbial species. The results showed that people with hypothyroidism had a significantly higher prevalence of SIBO compared to controls (33% vs. 15%).
Mathur and colleagues then further evaluated four groups: SIBO-positive with hypothyroidism, SIBO-negative with hypothyroidism, SIBO-positive without thyroid disease, and SIBO-negative without thyroid disease.
The analysis showed different patterns of bacteria in the gut depending on a person's thyroid status and co-occurrence of SIBO.
Separately, they performed a large-scale analysis of medical records from the TriNetX database, which looked at the 10-year risks of developing SIBO in people with hypothyroidism or autoimmune thyroiditis compared to matched controls. The risks were also mitigated in people taking levothyroxine.
"Results showed the risk of developing SIBO in subjects with hypothyroidism is 2.2 times more than the risk in a matched control cohort and was 2.4 times higher in those with autoimmune thyroiditis compared to a matched control group," noted Margaret Wei, M.D.

author: Valbuja Novice
title: NUNCA NA VIDA VI UM BUG DESSES - VÍDEO
text:
55 minutos atrás
Comprei o EA FC 25.
Pois bem, consegui jogar 3 partidas, e no dia seguinte o jogo simplesmente "deixou de existir".
O que acontece é que a tela de abertura (aquela com o famoso 'EA Sports') aparece, mas sem imagem, só ouço a voz e vejo uns flashes verdes e brancos como se estivesse assistindo a um filme, mas atrás de uma porta com vidro grosso e embaçado. Após pular isso, o menu de selecionar o save aparece normal, mas quando carrego meu save nada mais aparece. Apenas o fundo do estádio, sem menu, sem opções, sem nada! Eu clico nos botões e o único feedback é um zoom maluco daqueles botões para selecionar SIM ou NÃO, por exemplo "deseja encerrar o jogo?". Veja a gravação que fiz.
Isso está insano. Eu comprei o jogo, gastei meu dinheiro, mas recebi um erro bizarro que nem o suporte da EA consegue resolver update atrás de update. E as resoluções que me deram numa tentiva de contacto? "Verifique drivers, reinstale o jogo" – sério, pessoal? Sou filho de informático e já tentei tudo o que é possível e NADA resolve.
Agora, para completar a 'comédia'... comprei o jogo na Steam e, como se não bastasse, não posso nem pedir reembolso porque já vou com 5 horas de gameplay (por causa dos erros e tentativas de resolver) e aí Steam não devolve nada, e mesmo se der, vou receber crédito na loja, que nem vou usar, já que não aguento mais essa empresa! Parece até piada. Paguei por um jogo e o que recebi? Um produto que não funciona. E a EA não está nem aí.
É um ROUBO autêntico. Eu só queria jogar, não tenho mais paciência para esperar milagres. Estou pedindo um reembolso direto com a EA, e sim, sei que pode não ser possível, mas é um direito do consumidor que me foi tirado, e quem paga a conta sou eu! Essa empresa não merece mais a minha confiança. A quem mais está com problemas desse tipo, vamos tentar fazer algo, porque está claro que a EA não está nem aí para os problemas dos jogadores.
Tiago Gaspar
